prick.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to make a small hole in something using something sharp
prick.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Prick the sausages before you grill them.
She had pricked her finger on a rose thorn.
prick.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if something pricks a part of your body, or if it pricks, you feel small sharp pains
prick.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a very offensive word for a stupid unpleasant man. Do not use this word.
prick.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a slight pain you get when something sharp goes into your skin
prick.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: I didnâ€™t feel the prick of the needle.
prick.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: a sudden slight feeling you get when you are unhappy about something
prick.translation[1].definitions[4].exam: She felt a prick of resentment when she saw them together.
